conclusion: Plan to analyze the v-t graph to determine acceleration between 1 and 3 seconds.
The v-t graph has velocity on the vertical axis and time on the horizontal axis with a horizontal line from 0 to 1 second and a diagonal line from 1 to 3 seconds.
Acceleration is the derivative of velocity with respect to time, represented by the slope of the v-t graph.
Identify the slope: The graph shows no change in velocity from 0 to 1 second and a constant rate of change from 1 to 3 seconds.
Calculate acceleration: The line from 1 to 3 seconds starts at (1, 0) and ends at (3, 2), indicating a change in velocity from 0 to 2 m/s over 2 seconds.
Compute slope: The slope (acceleration) is 2 m/s divided by 2 seconds, which equals 1 m/s².
The acceleration of the particle from 1 to 3 seconds is 1 m/s².
